A Guide to the Credit Women International Collection, 1984-1989
A Collection in
Special Collections SC 5060
Special Collections, Carrier Library, James Madison University 2013 &contact;
Processed by:
Chelsea Tholen

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: Materials present in this collection consist of two scrap books donated to Special Collections. This includes newsletters, photographs, flyers, and articles about the organization. It fills one Hollinger box and consists of 34 folders.
did.origination: Credit Women International, Harrisonburg, Virginia Chapter

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of Item], The Credit Women International Collection, 1984-1989, SC 5060, Special Collections, Carrier Library, James Madison University, Harrisonburg, VA.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Two scrapbooks were donated by Anne Harter on 7/14/2010

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Contents of the scrapbooks have been removed from the original binders and rehoused in acid-free folders.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: The Credit Women International is an organization in which women who are involved in a credit union can join. The Harrisonburg chapter was influential in establishing many other chapters, including the Winchester, Virginia chapter in 1985. The organization also held many fundraisers and met once a month with leading professionals in the area often addressing the organization.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Materials present in this collection consist of two scrapbooks donated to Special Collections. This includes newsletters, photographs, flyers and articles about the organization. It fills one Hollinger box and consists of 34 folders.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in II series:
